website_summaries.verdict: The perfect attachment for anyone looking to make healthy, low-carb zucchini noodles.
pros: Durable, well made attachment has a comfortable grip handle
Easily attaches to all KitchenAid mixers with just a few quick steps
The perfect way to make healthy zucchini or eggplant lasagna noodles
Attachment is easy to clean and is dishwasher safe
cons: Does not work well with soft or mushy vegetables

customer_reviews.title: Looks good overall, but one plastic piece that engages the ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks good overall, but one plastic piece that engages the mixer is very flimsy and it broke on the second use, now it wont turn. Very disappointed as i was looking forward to using it alot.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandar

customer_reviews.title: Fun Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: This attachment is so much fun. My first experiment was making mini apple pies without the crust. I sliced the apples (one per well) using the thin blade, rolled them up and put them in the wells of my large muffin tin (they look like roses). Sprinkled them with butter, sugar, cinnamon and boiled cider. Baked them for 40 minutes. So good and so easy. Great tool for veggie wraps. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Clemmons

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't have done it without ya
customer_reviews.text: Great for sheeting apples, potatoes, zucchini and cucumber. Vegetables used must be firm and roughly 5 inches in length. The core is about the size of a nickel so you either have to throw that away or get creative and slice those by hand. Quick and easy once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Berg

customer_reviews.title: Really a plus to dehydrating vegetables and fruit and so many other uses.
customer_reviews.text: This is just wonderful. I made lasagna with zucchini noodles and it turned out really great. KitchenAid was wonderful and advised to refrigerate the zucchini about 5 minutes or so to make it more firm to be sliced...worked just fine then. I sliced an apple and was very pleased at how easy it worked. I plan to make a pie with apples using this and add caramel. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hanna

customer_reviews.title: I love my new kitchen toy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a VERY OLD KitchenAid, from the mid-1970’s that belonged to my grandmother. This sheet cutter attachment works just fine for my old girl! It’s very easy to use, although I’d recommend that a newbie watch the quick start videos provided on the KitchenAid website before trying it for the first time to prevent user error. I’m a celiac on a gluten free diet and I know this tool will provide some creative alternatives to bread wraps and noodles. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Grace K. Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This attachment is only good with certain vegetables & fruit. You CANNOT peel an eggplant. The vegetable/fruit MUST be a certain size or it will not work. For me - it was a waste of money. Buy a mandolin and slice your own. It is large & clunky and takes up alot of space. Think about exactly what you need it for before going through the hassle of buying it and returning it like I did .
customer_reviews.author: YourHonor

customer_reviews.title: This attachment is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered this and have been seriously impressed with how easy it is to use! We used it with apples and sweet potatoes. The sweet potato was harder to pierce to get it into the attachment, so my husband pre-pierced it and then fed it into the attachment. This is going to take eating to a whole new level as we make food look more interesting.
customer_reviews.author: daffy

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Plastic adapters maybe should be made of metal.
customer_reviews.text: Sheet cutter works well. I’d give it 5 stars, but I just wish the finned adapters (which spin the vegetable) were made of metal as opposed to plastic. It worked well when used on a sweet potato, but I can see breaking it if I put pressure on it the wrong way.
customer_reviews.author: newb uke

customer_reviews.title: A lot of wasted food
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this product. It was awkward to use at first. It did produce a thin sheet, but the sheet was very limited in length because it was impossible to find veggies with a big enough circumference to produce a long sheet. There was a lot of waste because it stopped turning when the core was down to about one inch in diameter. It did not work at all on some vegetables like eggplant ( the prongs tore the eggplant and it did not turn). I returned the sheeter and got my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Sheilarf

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy!
customer_reviews.text: Have used to make wraps with Zucchini and Cucumbers. This is very easy to use and clean. I wish the sheet sizes were a little wider but that is very minor. This product is great if you are eating the Paleo or Whole 30 life style. Makes an easy alternative to bread and wraps. I am looking forward to making a vegetable lasagna next and see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Lenix

customer_reviews.title: I’d like to say this item was what I expected but ...
customer_reviews.text: I’d like to say this item was what I expected but sadly no. Once you get it set up, it was inconsistent in cutting sheets. There was also a good deal of the vegetable/fruit remaining not cut. You must use firm vegetables & fruit or they will split & be useless. (This would have nice to know before I started) When it did cut the sheets of vegetables/fruit, it was very nice. To me, it seems like a lot of work for something that’s supposed to be easy. I’ll try again but have much lower expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There is too much of your produce center core left ...
customer_reviews.text: There is too much of your produce center core left when the slicing is complete. Unless you use that in some other manner, it is just wasteful. I, too, wish I had researched this a little more before making an impulse buy for another "neat" gadget. It does work very well, though, for slicing those thin sheets. I just don't see me using it much, if at all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Not as useful as we had hoped
customer_reviews.text: This attachment was pretty good for making sheets of zucchini to use in a pasta dish. It wasn’t quite as useful as we imagined (difficult to make zucchini sheets), and was difficult to clean, so we ended up returning it. Maybe it’s more useful if you live in an area where vegetables grow larger and plan to use vegetable sheets more often in recipes than we did.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Now that's the Sheet!
customer_reviews.text: If you want veggies and or fruit sheeted and have a kitchenaid mixer then look no further. This attachment os so cool and nifty to use. It really makes presentation and eating alot more fun. Oh the possibilities of doing different types of recipes and even makes it simple to hide veggies from unsuspecting picky kiddie eaters,lol. Your imagination is the only thing to let loose with this device. I love it. Kitchenaid is a great company and this is such a wonderful addition to an already impressive machine.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: ... to get the hang of it then we made sweet potato chips and fell in love with it
customer_reviews.text: Took an evening to get the hang of it then we made sweet potato chips and fell in love with it. Much nicer than using the food processor slicer - and could cut to the size we wanted after the spiral was done.
customer_reviews.author: tklaiber

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says - cuts long, thin sheets of fruits and veggies.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I admit it....we bought this more as a novelty, because really, it's uses are limited and I prefer the spiralizer. But to "impress" friends and have a bit of fun, this is okay. Used it on apples - nice, long, continuous, sheet of apple with just the core remaining (which one throws out usually anyway.) A firmer apple works better, I've found. Made some nice fruit and cheese wraps that we then cut into slices. Cut both white and sweet potatoes well, but they tend to break into pieces. Easy to use. Easy to clean. We probably won't use it much, but just had to try it. :/
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy Lady

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so much fun to use. I made cucumber wraps with goat cheese, tzatziki, and grape tomato (halved) and it is SO GOOD. I saw recipes for potato wrap enchiladas and zucchini lasagna and im trying both this week! I also want to slice apples like this before dehydrating so I can cut strips instead of using a mandoline to cut chips and the have to remove the seeds and blah blah blah.....dude I can use cookie cutters and make fun shapes ♡ I'm so excited. And I got a shredder too so the cores can be used up instead of getting tossed. That zucchini core can be zucchini bread and the potato core can become hashbrowns 🥰
customer_reviews.author: Kmgoldsworthy

customer_reviews.title: Good product but wasteful
customer_reviews.text: I must say I like what it does, great product, but there is a big problem that I was not aware of. There is a large amount of product that is wasted. Almost half of your fruit or vegetable is wasted and this is why I do not rate it higher. Not sure if all similar products waste the same but I would bet they do. You have to get creative on what to do with the core, literally half is left.
customer_reviews.author: Corderito

customer_reviews.title: I love the way I can make paper thin slices
customer_reviews.text: I love the way I can make paper thin slices, which can be rolled up to look like flowers for filled with deviled eggs. Makes wonderful appetizers.
customer_reviews.author: Copboots

customer_reviews.title: A best friend.
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this. Since I recieved it I have used it almost daily! I have been using it for everything from quiche made with beets or rutabaga as the crust to breakfast wraps made out of rutabaga, and "sushi wraps made with cucumber. Oh and baked sheeted apples are so GOOD.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Bugge

customer_reviews.title: Have you ever seen a 4 foot sheet of zucchini?  Now you can!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to our kitchen arsenal. Those zucchini don't stand a chance. Makes great sheets for low-carb lasagna. Can also make decorative fruit desserts. The cutter is easy to install in the port on the front of the stand mixer and is easy to clean. The storage box is like a jigsaw puzzle, so pay attention if you intend to put everything back in there for storage.
customer_reviews.author: BAKSTL

customer_reviews.title: Great for solid soft cylindrical uniform veggies
customer_reviews.text: Really selective on what you can use it for. Certain items have to be absolutely specific at their point of density and reason for what you want to use it for. Definitely does not do hard vegetables like carrots unless they are blanched fully soft like a zucchini. Large seeded vegetables do not work at all.
customer_reviews.author: EWL

customer_reviews.title: Fun & Healthy!
customer_reviews.text: Fun and healthy. Zucchini lasagna is amazing. Find a good recipe on the internet and start eating healthier.
customer_reviews.author: Sal D. New Jersey

customer_reviews.title: It's Ok
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had researched this attachment a little more. If you have a fat/large cucumber, zucchini it works really well. If your veggie is small in diameter, you might only get a slice or two. If cucumber has a soft inner, then the pronged attachment will just spin and it will not let the veggie turn to be sliced. Had I known this, I probably wouldn't have bought it. I think it will work great with potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Poe

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to finally receive my vegetable sheet cutter today! However, when I opened the KitchenAid box containing it, the inside of the box was covered in some sort of yellow substance. Maybe mold? Maybe food splatter from someone who used it previously and returned it? I don't know but it looks disgusting! I will now be returning it and will wait until I can purchase one directly at BB&B.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Jones

customer_reviews.title: Replace or enhance dishes with veggie sheets!
customer_reviews.text: First thing I did with this device is make zucchini sheets for lasagna, replacing the noodles. Video shows you the latest batch of veggie lasagna with zucchini noodles. It's also handy for cucumber wrappers for spring rolls. It's worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Moore

customer_reviews.title: 00 piece of crap! You are lucky to get 1 sheet out ...
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a $100.00 piece of crap! You are lucky to get 1 sheet out of 4 zucchini.. If the zucchini is slightly bent forget it. With only allowing a length of 4.5" you have a lot of wasted with that and how much is left when it will not longer spin. I love Kitchen Aid and worked in retail and have touted this brand for 25 years. This component is the worst!
customer_reviews.author: kim villegas

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to cut veggies
customer_reviews.text: Is not what I expected. Kind of difficult to cut the veggies because either gets stuck or it won’t cut but once it does is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Heyda L. Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Needs re-engineering
customer_reviews.text: It makes great sheets; however, it took a while and watching several instructional videos to get it assembled right. This attachment needs to be worked over by an engineer so it doesn't waste almost half of your vegetable. You end up with a pretty big core left after the sheeter refuses to cut any further. But I will say it made perfectly lovely vegetables sheets.
customer_reviews.author: HHapE2Give

customer_reviews.title: What a find!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! It makes sheets out of just about any vegetable. There are two blades one for softer veggies like zucchini, one for firmer ones like potatoes. I made lasagna with sheets of zucchini instead of noodle and potato rollups filled with meat, cheese, etc. I've had a lot of fun with my new kitchen toy. Can't wait to try more vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Marino Michielsen

customer_reviews.title: Keto life!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing!!!! We made lasagna and the zucchini noodles were perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for our health
customer_reviews.text: Love it, made lasagna noodles out of zucchini last night. It was delicious. This was so simple to use. Can't wait to try cutting other vegetables and try more recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: It's Kitchenaid... what's not to like
customer_reviews.text: I love this attachment so easy to put together, use, and clean ... such a great buy for the price. Although a nicer container would be nice than just cardboard-like material (although it's quite sturdy). Love making my zucchini lasagna with it. Definitely recommend to a friend or family member.
customer_reviews.author: Alibabalu

customer_reviews.title: Great new way to KitchenAid
customer_reviews.text: One of the funnest attachments we have for the KitchenAid. So far, we've used it for zucchini, apples and potatoes. Works like a charm. Opens up all sorts of creative new ways of doing our favorite dishes.
customer_reviews.author: MLS-BG

customer_reviews.title: How did I live with out this?
customer_reviews.text: This allows your sushi to move to the next level without having to learn fancy knife work. That is only the beginning. It is great for making sheets of pickled daikon. You can also make veggie wraps for stuff out of any solid vegetable you can fit in there. The center cylinders you are left with also have fun uses.
customer_reviews.author: Albatross Necklace

customer_reviews.title: Like the attachment
customer_reviews.text: Although the attachment performs exactly as advertised, I must admit making zucchini lasagna was a bit tedious since I had to cut each one in half and put them on the skewer... take it off the skewer. I probably won't be making that dish any time soon (although delicious). I'll probably use it for much less labor intensive cooking
customer_reviews.author: PinkyMA

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: This baby is very "slick". I love it. I made the Zucchini Rolls which turned out delish! The zucchini holds up very well in baking and has a firm, crunchy texture. The progress was very quick and easy. If I were to state a negative, it would be the size of the core left behind. (On the dish, I just cut the cores open and stuffed them as well, also delish.) Plus be sure to use firm, larger sized vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Southerton

customer_reviews.title: It works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I love it and score it five stars on every aspects. The sheets are just beautiful. The sheet cutter changes the style of my cooking. Now I start to make veggie rolls, and veggie meat rolls.
customer_reviews.author: Zhong

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: concept is great, but unless you have a fat zucchini it dose not really work like video.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERSATILE attachment
customer_reviews.text: Great attachment for the mixer. It has been used for cucumbers to make little sushi type appetizers, peel apples to apply peanut butter, just an overall great attachment.
customer_reviews.author: James Womack

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a KA Addict, I love this item. I make Potato Lasagna, and a Potato Verde Enchilada that was awesome. I am finding amazing recipes on Facebook, also KA has online recipes. Use Your Imagination, and Go Wild !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paulsgirl

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't hold the vegetables well.
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful for this item but It doesn't hold the vegetables well. I missed out on returning this item. I was expecting better results, we tried to shave a sweet potato and it struggled to keep a hold of it from the mechanism closest to the mixer, it would bore a hole into the potato. Not worth it. I also purchased a shredder attachment and that one works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect way to eat veggies
customer_reviews.text: I did a perfect lasagna with potatoes, beet, turnip, cucumber, eggplant, carrot and zucchini. Every vegetable must be fresh and has to be cut to fit in the attachment. It's very easy to clean. The box is just the right size for keep all the parts in the box.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! And it CAN do butternut squash if you keep it first! Also, fat carrots, zucchini, sweet or white potatoes, diacon radishes, apples, fat cucumbers... Super cool... Super fun!
customer_reviews.author: MICHELE

customer_reviews.title: Making sheets for meals like lasagna is more challenging with a hand crank unit
customer_reviews.text: We started substituting veggies for pasta a while back and have tried a few different hand crank spiralizers. Making sheets for meals like lasagna is more challenging with a hand crank unit. This attachment for the KitchenAid is great. Easier to use for sure. It makes the prep a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: A really sharp knife and a steady hand is the best way to do this!
customer_reviews.text: All though I like the idea it’s not an item after using it that says I want to use it again this week maybe on special occasions maybe I can experiment more with this kitchen gadget and come up with ideas to use it with but wish they could have designed it to do the spiralized vegetables to instead of having to buy a different attachment I mean this was was kind of expensive as limited as it is!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Lee

customer_reviews.title: If you don't know about this wonderful product then u r not from this planet
customer_reviews.text: KitchenAid. If you don't know about this wonderful product then u r not from this planet. Its a durable design that stands the test of time for generations. My favorite feature is its versatility in its myriad attachments. It is a great kitchen multitasker. Oh the sheet cutter. That's a great tool also.
customer_reviews.author: Ron sejour

customer_reviews.title: Love my KitchenAid and this tool - great for more ...
customer_reviews.text: No longer bake that much, but attachments make my life so much easier! Love my KitchenAid and this tool - great for more healthy cooking!
customer_reviews.author: Linda S. Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: The packaging
customer_reviews.text: It was in the original box but the tape seals were cut, there was dust and dirt inside the box next to the parts. A poorly presentation for a new product.
customer_reviews.author: Scrap Hobbies

customer_reviews.title: Best Kitchen appliance  investment I've bought in a long time
customer_reviews.text: Due to intolerances, I don't eat any wheat and oat grains. I made lasagne using potatoes, sweet potato, and zucchini sheets. I used the thin blade and only used 2 smaller potatoes, 1 sweet potato, and 1 zucchini. It was so yum!!! I had a fair amount of scraps, so I ate the zucchini as a snack and made potato chips with the rest. The best potato chips and sweet potato chips ever! Perhaps this attachment isn't so good for my waistline...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I purchased it sooner
customer_reviews.text: I truly enjoy all Kitchenaid products. They are simply built to last and couldn’t be any easier to use. From never using this product before, from out of the box to using it and making my first apple roll was less than 3 minutes. I couldn’t believe I got about 7 feet of continuous sheet of an apple. From there my I realized that I can get really creative with this product
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing and cuts down on prep time! I have made baked apple crisps and cucumber rolls. My next step is making zucchini lasagna- and I'll be experimenting with my sweet potatoes!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box, read the quick start guide and had instant success. Super easy to you. I made an Invisible apple cake in minutes. It was so fast at sheeting apples, I was shocked! I've read complaints that it is wasteful, I don't agree with that. It leaves about a 3/4" core. I wouldn't eat an apple core. I also used it to sheet some medium sized zucchini. If you like the seedy center of over grown zucchini, then yes you might consider it wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Royal

customer_reviews.title: You can’t miss it u til you buy one!
customer_reviews.text: Wife uses this thing all the time for tons of dishes. Sometimes I wonder how she ever got by without it. Gets a workout and still going!
customer_reviews.author: Mopar Madness

customer_reviews.title: great for vegetable lasagna recipes
customer_reviews.text: made scalloped potatoes in an entirely different way. great for vegetable lasagna recipes. Haven't tried deep frying yet, but it is on the agenda
customer_reviews.author: sc

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to attach and use. I was thrilled when my apple just peeled into slices. This was so easy!!!! I can't wait to do more with it.
customer_reviews.author: Roseann Ott

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I use this for zucchini lasagna. Works well and is easy to use. You can also use it to make veggie wraps for other snacks.
customer_reviews.author: Aceani

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! We both use it a lot & my ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! We both use it a lot & my nephew who likes to cook, played with it & created 'potato lassangia'.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Haas

customer_reviews.title: but fun.
customer_reviews.text: It works. A bit of a pain to use, but fun.
customer_reviews.author: John Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a birthday present back in August and gave it to my daughter last week. She tells me that it is only an attachment for a Kitchen aid appliance which she doesn't have. From the picture in the add, I thought it was a complete unit and now it is too late to return it. The picture was deceptive and we are out $74
customer_reviews.author: Judith G.

customer_reviews.title: Love My Kitchen Aid and the fun toys that you can use with it
customer_reviews.text: What a fun toy. Love the sheets, sweet potato sheets make AWESOME enchiladas
customer_reviews.author: Raye W.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on a gluten free diet, and already have used this for cucumber pin wheels with ham and cream cheese, zucchini lasagna, and potato enchiladas. It was easy to substitute vegetables instead of pasta or flour tortillas. I just rinsed the attachment off when I was finished and stored it back in the box. The possibilities are endless. I still have many recipes to try out.
customer_reviews.author: Shayla

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!game changer! buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I have lost 35 pounds with the keto diet I absolutely love this device my lasagna is impeccable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: my wife had to try it out as soon as ...
customer_reviews.text: my wife had to try it out as soon as it arrived. Vegie sheets as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very Satisfied !!! 5 Stars, Super fast shipping, excellent service and awesome product, will buy again, Thanks
customer_reviews.author: F-16 Falcon

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory
customer_reviews.text: Really like the this attachment. Won't use it everyday, but it puts a great spin on recipes! Prompt shipping, too.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Galvao-Penick

customer_reviews.title: Used and open product!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Im so extremely disappointed. This product is SHIPPED and COMES FROM amazon themselves!! I thought they would be a little more legit, and have more control of their products. This product came open AND used!!! Used! Parts were dirty like someone used it and put it back. Box wasnt sealed. Unbelievable really. I was looking foward in using this product. I guess i was wrong in that if amazon sells it it must be legit, and come with more of a security. What a let down amazon
customer_reviews.author: diana patterson

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lots of waste. need a huge perfect vegetable for it to work properly
customer_reviews.author: S. Bernier

customer_reviews.title: So easy and so fun!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, it allows me to substitute pasta for vegetables and fruits, in several delicious and healthy recipes. A great acquisition, for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre Fachin

customer_reviews.title: Fun with Food!
customer_reviews.text: Really great to use this item to make low carb lasagna. Great invention! Kids love what it does to an apple! May buy another as a Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jynjr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and a great way to get more veggies into your diet
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. Kitchen aid makes the greatest attachments for their machine. It is great for making veggie roll ups or veggie lasagne without having to use pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon M. Zuzgo

customer_reviews.title: Love making sheets out of zucchini for lasagna
customer_reviews.text: Love making sheets out of zucchini for lasagna. Have also made apple sheets so far. Very easy to set up, quick to use, and easy to clean. Glad I finally got one!
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this sheet cutter just to make lasagna noodles out of zucchini! It was so easy to assemble, and use! In the matter of minutes I had 5 pans worth of zucchini noodles. I over did it, but had so much fun using it.
customer_reviews.author: B.Browning

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I use this 2-3 times a week for roll ups with cucumbers and zucchini. Great quality. easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Betts

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can make low carb lasagna thanks to this! It does have a learning curve, but works great!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Chiniewicz

customer_reviews.title: Have not been able to use it yet.. ...
customer_reviews.text: Have not been able to use it yet....it was missing one of the little plastic things that go into the vege....so trying to figure out how to improvise...but it is designed well and heavy duty ...
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this! Make great sheets for zucchini lasagne.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquie B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome attachment!
customer_reviews.text: Love all the possibilities this opens up for us. Makes great lasagna noodles but also can use them for manicotti. Cut for fettuccine, linguine, egg noodle size, whatever you want. Really surprised at how easy to use this item is. Love my Kitchen Aid and love this attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Mattea

customer_reviews.title: Love this attachment
customer_reviews.text: I love this attachment. I have made so many different meals using the sheeter.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Scott

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to kitchen toy collection
customer_reviews.text: I like the device. Made sweet potato and cucumber sheets so far. Need to figure out what to do with the vegetable cores left over.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly fits our kitchen aid. We used this with ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly fits our kitchen aid. We used this with apples! Then put peanut butter on it and rolled them up!! Delicious and healthy for my grand child!!
customer_reviews.author: MERRILEE

customer_reviews.title: This is just like it says, cuts down on time and saves your fingers from using a mandolin.

customer_reviews.title: Requires 4-5 small zucchini for a lasagna

product_meta.title: KitchenAid Vegetable Sheet Cutter, 1, Metallic
product_meta.description: Reinvent classic meals and inspire your culinary creativity with fresh fruits and vegetables. The KitchenAid Vegetable Sheet Cutter Attachment produces thin sheets of zucchini, apples, cucumber and other fruits and vegetables. From substituting pasta and wraps with vegetable sheets, to reinventing snacks and sweet dishes, the options are endless.
feature_bullets: Attaches to Power Hub of your stand mixer and uses the power of the motor to run the attachment
Fits all Household KitchenAid Stand Mixers
Create sheets of zucchini, apples, cucumbers and other fruits and vegetables, and inspire fresh versions of everyday dishes
Two blades allow you to produce thinner or thicker sheets, depending on your preference or recipe
The vegetable sheet cutter packs and organizes inside its own storage case

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars738 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
